introText: Your reliable guide for hassle-free travel. Explore tips, guides, and useful tools for your adventures from Mexico to the world.
faqsText: Answers to the most frequently asked questions about procedures and travel.
servicesDescription: Explore our services to plan your trip:
planTripToUS: Plan your trip to the United States
cbxDescription: From Mexico, the Cross Border Xpress (CBX) is an excellent option to cross the border quickly and safely. We show you the best routes and tips.
japanDescription: Japan is a fascinating destination with a rich history and culture. Here we help you plan your trip from Narita Airport to Tokyo.
recommendedRoutes: Recommended routes to reach your destination.
aboutUsDescription: At VoxMex, we are dedicated to making your travels easier and helping you plan your activities efficiently. We believe in the power of clear and accessible information to reduce travel stress and allow you to enjoy every moment.
missionDescription: To help travelers fulfill their dreams of exploring the world by providing practical tools and guides to simplify the process.
visionDescription: To be the go-to platform for travelers seeking support from planning to return, creating a united and well-informed community.

visas.title: Visa Information
visas.widgetText: Find all the necessary information to successfully apply for your visa.

requiredDocuments.title: Required Documents
requiredDocuments.passportDetails: A valid passport with at least six months of validity.
requiredDocuments.photoDetails: Photos will be taken on the day of your appointment.
requiredDocuments.applicationFormDetails: Submit the form online at the official website.
requiredDocuments.paymentReceiptDetails: Non-refundable payment receipt for the application fee.
requiredDocuments.supportingDocumentsDetails: Documents proving ties to your home country, such as employment letters or property ownership.

q1.question: What should I bring to my visa appointment?
q1.answer: Bring your passport, DS-160 confirmation, payment receipt, and any supporting documents.

q2.question: Can I bring my phone to the appointment?
q2.answer: Electronic devices are not allowed inside the embassy or consulate.

q3.question: What happens during the appointment?
q3.answer: Your photo and fingerprints will be taken, and an interview will be conducted.

q4.question: Is identification required?
q4.answer: Identification is not always necessary, but it is recommended to bring one.

q5.question: Can I get a refund if my visa is denied?
q5.answer: The application fee is non-refundable, regardless of the outcome.

tips.title: Helpful Tips
tips.arriveEarly: Arrive at least 15 minutes before your scheduled appointment.
tips.prepareAnswers: Prepare concise answers to potential questions about your trip.
tips.avoidNervousness: Stay calm and answer honestly during the interview.
tips.checkDocuments: Double-check all required documents before your appointment.
tips.electronicDevices: Do not bring electronic devices or large bags to the appointment.
tips.metalObjects: Avoid carrying metal objects to pass security quickly.

q1.question: What is the DS-160 form?
q1.answer: The DS-160, Online Nonimmigrant Visa Application form, is for temporary travel to the United States, and for K (fiancÃ©(e)) visas.

q2.question: How do I complete the DS-160 form?
q2.answer: You must complete the DS-160 form online at the Consular Electronic Application Center (CEAC) website.

q3.question: What documents do I need to complete the DS-160 form?
q3.answer: You will need your passport, travel itinerary, dates of your last five visits to the United States, and your resume or curriculum vitae.

q4.question: Can I save my DS-160 form and complete it later?
q4.answer: Yes, you can save your application and complete it later. Make sure to note your application ID.

q5.question: What should I do if I make a mistake on my DS-160 form?
q5.answer: If you make a mistake, you will need to complete a new DS-160 form.

travelTips.title: Travel Tips
travelTips.widgetText: Practical guides to make the most of your experience abroad.

general.packingDetails: Bring only what you need to avoid carrying extra weight.
general.medsDetails: Carry your medications in their original packaging.
general.insuranceDetails: Get travel insurance to cover medical emergencies.
general.currencyDetails: Exchange money at currency exchange offices for better rates.
general.vaccinesDetails: Check if you need any special vaccinations for your destination.
general.emergencyDetails: Carry a list of emergency numbers and contacts.

snow.packingDetails: Cold climates may require warmer clothing.
snow.medsDetails: Medications should be protected from the cold. Bring enough for the duration of your trip.
snow.insuranceDetails: Travel insurance should cover illnesses related to cold weather.
snow.vaccinesDetails: Vaccinations against flu and common cold-weather illnesses.
snow.emergencyDetails: Carry a list of emergency numbers and contacts and have an emergency plan for snowstorms.

tropical.packingDetails: Tropical climates may require less clothing suited for the heat.
tropical.medsDetails: Consider humidity and heat when packing your medications.
tropical.insuranceDetails: Travel insurance should cover tropical diseases and insect protection.
tropical.vaccinesDetails: Vaccinations against tropical diseases and yellow fever.
tropical.emergencyDetails: Carry a list of emergency numbers and contacts and have an emergency plan for tropical diseases.

us.packingDetails: Bring only what you need to avoid carrying extra weight.
us.medsDetails: Carry your medications in their original packaging.
us.insuranceDetails: Get travel insurance to cover medical emergencies.
us.currencyDetails: Exchange money at currency exchange offices for better rates.
us.vaccinesDetails: Check if you need any special vaccinations for your destination.
us.emergencyDetails: Carry a list of emergency numbers and contacts.
us.transportationDetails: Familiarize yourself with public and private transportation options.
us.accommodationDetails: Book your accommodation in advance to get better rates.
us.foodDetails: Try local food and follow hygiene recommendations.
us.safetyDetails: Keep your belongings secure and follow local safety guidelines.
